title: prompt evaluation
description: Use Lana to evaluate the quality of the prompt before sending to Nolan

title: Agent/Role creation assitance
description: Use Lana to assist in building agents/teams, it needs to have Nolan agent/team structure templates/definitons

title: Agent Psych Eval for all workflow executions
description: Neeed a post worklfow Psych Eval agent for all agents so we can catch slow agents, misguided agents, stuck agents, hook errors, cheaters, prompt hackers, missing context provided, etxc

title: Handoff trigger Spawn
description: Instead of launching all agents, we should launch them programatically with the handoff itself, no need to have all agents up at first. But maintain all of them up in case of rejection and backward movement of workflow. But they wake up in order, then stay put till the end for the psych eval

title: Agent/Team design decision tracking
description: We are constantly updating agent files and team workflows, but we are not tracking those decisions, and sometimes we go in circles, we need to have a proper lessons learned document and functional requirement contract file for agent/team design so we dont unintentionally break behaviour or repeat wrong design patterns

title: Code indexer library
description: Every time a team/agent needs to grab context from the codebase it searches via globs and grep, we need to create a cron agent that keeps updated an index/library/definition file so agents can more effectively find what they need (like humans do with librarians and book idexes)

title: UI design patter descriptions
description: Create a design pattern and have a cron agent that fixes the UI daily to match

title: More cron agents for repetitive tasks
description: Find bugs, security issues, UI issues,

title: Execution Metrics
description: Monitoring project executions with task count, team size, prompt quality, output quality,

title: Task Monitoring Dashboard
description: Real-time monitoring page for active agent tasks. Show which agents are working on what, current phase/step, time elapsed, blockers encountered. Not a kanban (that's for ideas/specs), but an operational view of what's happening now. Think mission control for agent work.

title: Merge Conflict & Test Results Monitor
description: Surface merge conflicts when agents work on overlapping code. Alert when agent changes cause test failures or break the build. Show test pass/fail status per agent session. Detect when multiple agents touch same files and flag potential conflicts before they become git problems.

title: Agent Approval Gates
description: Define checkpoints where agents must pause for human approval. Configure per-team or per-agent rules: require approval before commits to main, before external API calls, before file deletions, before pushing to remote. Queue pending approvals in Nolan UI with context of what the agent wants to do.

title: Work Isolation with Git Worktrees
description: Each workflow execution gets its own git worktree so agents don't step on each other. Automatic branch creation per task/project. Easy rollback if an agent breaks something. Prevents the chaos of multiple agents editing the same files simultaneously. Shows active worktrees and their status in Nolan.

title: Rust-to-TypeScript Type Generation
description: Add ts-rs to auto-generate TypeScript types from Rust structs. Eliminates manual type sync between frontend and backend. Compile-time guarantee that API contracts match. No more runtime type mismatches or outdated type definitions.

title: Layered State Management
description: Separate server state from UI state more cleanly. Use React Query systematically for all API data (caching, deduplication, background sync). Keep Zustand stores for pure UI state only (collapsed panels, scroll positions). Add Context providers for complex cross-cutting domain state.

title: Virtual Scrolling with react-virtuoso
description: Replace react-window with react-virtuoso for better virtual scrolling. Better API, handles variable height items, smoother scrolling for agent output panels and long lists. More consistent performance when displaying thousands of log lines.

title: Extract More Custom Hooks
description: Currently only 4 custom hooks. Extract reusable domain logic into hooks: useAgentStatus, useProjectFiles, useCronosJobs, useWorkflowPhase, useTeamAvailability, etc. Cleaner components, better testability, consistent patterns across the app.

title: Semantic Design Tokens
description: Add semantic color tokens to Tailwind config: text-high/normal/low, bg-primary/secondary/panel. More meaningful than raw colors, easier theming, consistent visual hierarchy. Makes it clear what each color means rather than guessing hex values.

title: Error Tracking with Sentry
description: Add Sentry integration for production error tracking. Catch errors users don't report, get stack traces with context, track error frequency and impact. Essential for understanding what breaks in real usage.

title: separate app source code from app folders
description: To prepare for multi user support, we need to split source code from app data folders.
